channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Social care: PM to unveil overhaul of sector in England
item.description: Boris Johnson will set out plans on Tuesday, amid a Tory backlash to tax rises to cover costs.

item.title: Dylan Rich: Young footballer who died was much-loved, says head
item.description: Dylan Rich, 17, is suspected to have had a cardiac arrest during a game in Nottinghamshire.

item.title: Kickboxer Saeideh Aletaha: Brothers feared fatal fight was unfair
item.description: Saeideh Aletaha, 26, died a day after being knocked out at an organised bout in Southampton in 2019.

item.title: Muppets creator Jim Henson's Hampstead home given blue plaque
item.description: The plaque is on the Hampstead house where Jim Henson lived for more than a decade.

item.title: Romiley robbery: Boy, 15, detained for killing restaurateur
item.description: Mohammed Islam, 53, died two days after he was hit by his own car in a robbery.

item.title: Poodle killed in 'horrific' dog attack in Poplar
item.description: Ruby's owner wants a change in the law to allow owners to be prosecuted for dog-on-dog attacks.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Hundreds mourn toddler and dad
item.description: Sophie Martyn was walking with her father Lee, 43, when they were shot dead by Jake Davison.

item.title: Red Funnel Southampton check-in kiosk flattened by lorry
item.description: Staff members and passengers rush to help three people working inside a ferry kiosk in Southampton.

item.title: Channel migrants: Children among those brought ashore at Dungeness
item.description: A steady stream of crossings is thought to be have taken place amid calm waters and sunny skies.

item.title: Newcastle mayor 'infuriated' by mosque firework attack
item.description: Habib Rahman said youths hurled fireworks and racist insults at people attending a Newcastle mosque.

item.title: ‘Rare’ Bath city-centre parking space sold for £115,000
item.description: The spot in the middle of Bath was sold just two days after being listed online.

item.title: Rapper Wiley charged with east London assault and burglary
item.description: Wiley is accused of assault by beating and burglary with intent to cause criminal damage.

item.title: Roy 'Chubby' Brown: Sheffield cancellation sparks backlash
item.description: More than 24,000 people sign a petition urging venue bosses in Sheffield to reverse their decision.

item.title: 'Why not have festivals that only women can attend?'
item.description: The idea for the three-day LBTQ Femme Fest was conceived on social media during lockdown.

item.title: Meteor caught on camera over Southampton docks
item.description: The shooting star was captured on camera over Southampton docks on Sunday night.

item.title: Should Whitehaven's planned coal mine be allowed?
item.description: Whitehaven residents share their thoughts on what could become the UK's first deep mine in 30 years.

item.title: London's unemployment situation explained
item.description: Why is the capital's unemployment rate is higher than the rest of the UK?

item.title: 'I hid my litter picker in my suitcase'
item.description: Jenny I'Anson, 73, says she can spend up to five hours a day clearing rubbish.

item.title: US Open 2021: Emma Raducanu into quarter-finals after beating Shelby Rogers
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu puts in another devastating performance to reach the US Open quarter-finals as her dream New York debut continues.

item.title: England v India: Jasprit Bumrah sets up tourists' 157-run win at Oval
item.description: England's batting disintegrates in the face of an inspired India, who win the fourth Test by 157 runs to take a 2-1 lead in the series.

item.title: County Championship: Yorkshire beat Somerset by an innings and 33 runs
item.description: Yorkshire wrap up a remarkable County Championship victory over Somerset inside two days.

item.title: Toby Flood: Ex-England, Leicester and Newcastle fly-half retires
item.description: Former England, Leicester and Newcastle fly-half Toby Flood retires from rugby union at the age of 36.

item.title: Manchester United to have Covid-19 spot-checks at Old Trafford starting with Newcastle game
item.description: Manchester United are to introduce Covid-19 spot-checks on matchdays at Old Trafford, starting with Saturday's game against Newcastle.
